#summary A description of PMTK tags, and how they are used.

= Tags =

  * Files in PMTK are annotated with tags indicating meta information such as the author, date, the running time etc, and are the basis for all All [http://code.google.com/p/pmtk3/wiki/updatingDocumentation PMTK reports].

  * Tags look like this, and can live anywhere in the file:
{{{
% PMTKauthor Matt Dunham
% PMTKdate  July 1, 2010
}}}

  * All tags begin with "PMTK". The remaining text after the space is the value of the tag. 

  * Tags must be preceded by the Matlab "%" comment symbol, even if the file contains no Matlab code. 

  * There are a number of tools that can help you obtain information about tags:

|| [http://pmtk3.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/toolbox/metatools/docTools/pmtkTagReport.m pmtkTagReport.m] || Generates a struct storing information on all tagged files in PMTK. ||
|| [http://pmtk3.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/toolbox/metatools/docTools/tagfinder.m tagfinder.m] || Returns a list of all tags and their values in a specified file. ||
|| [http://pmtk3.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/toolbox/metatools/docTools/hasTag.m hasTag.m] || Returns true, if a specified file has a specified tag. ||
|| [http://pmtk3.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/toolbox/metatools/docTools/findAllFilesWithTag.m findAllFilesWithTag.m] || Returns a list of all files with the specified tag. ||
|| [http://pmtk3.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/toolbox/metatools/docTools/getTagText.m getTagText.m] || Returns the text appearing after the tag in the specified file. ||
